result.execSummary:
All charges against Brooke Erin Thomas in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brooke Erin Thomas is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brooke Erin Thomas in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Brooke Erin Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial. State is unable to proceed. State lacks cooperation of an essential witness. Defense moves to dismiss. COUT ORDERED CASE DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Brooke Erin Thomas in Court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in Court for Brooke Erin Thomas.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Court addressed Motions in Limine, Witness Lists, and Jury Instructions. Court issued a Sequestration Order. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 15. Jury Trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.

Defendant Brooke Erin Thomas in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and requests a jury trial.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brooke Erin Thomas in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. 
Defense counsel in out sick. Defendant provided the next court.  Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
This hearing will be held in person. / This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 4-21-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Court ordered no contact with ANO.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Brooke Erin Thomas in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Brooke Erin Thomas not in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 4/28/2022, at 2:30 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
